Reviews.Title: “You can find a better place near by with more amenities near by for this price.”
Reviews.Author: SenatorMcCain
Reviews.Content: Nice clean place. Best fitness facility I've come across in a long time. Huge comfy chair w/ footstool - all furniture and room in great condition. My issues were no fridge in room, Poor coffee pot, no breakfast passes to the restaurant, nothing special for long time priority club member, and expensive. I stayed for 3 nights, these little things add up. Plus, I had stayed at a Staybridge in Syracuse the week prior, so maybe my expectations were raised? Will miss the gym next time I stay in The Windy City, but not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent Hotel close to Midway”
Reviews.Author: mjmcalpin
Reviews.Content: We traveled here last weekend for a boys volleyball tournament. The hotel was VERY convenient to Midway airport, and very INconvenient to O'Hare. Families traveling from O'Hare to this hotel on a Friday evening had almost a 2-hour train ride or a 1-hour cab ride. The hotel itself was fine - rooms were comfortable, fitness center was minimal but adequate, and the pool area was a lot of fun for the boys - a ping pong table and a foosball table kept the boys occupied. The pool was closed on Saturday due to a large group of children who were not potty-trained... uggghhh! The restaurant - Coaches - was just OK. Food was tolerable at best, kind of pricey for what you received, and the service was very slow. You are better off going to another area restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manteno
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to be close to the airport on a snowy night. The hotel is newer and is very nice. Has a nice bar/rest. Staff was friendly. Room had a new feel and was very clean. Would definitely recommend. Free parking and internet

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice for an airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MFRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: First time I've stayed in this part of Chicago, (Usually it's out at ORD or Downtown) and the hotel is very new & very nicely furnished. It's in a center with all of the major business hotels represented, and this appears to be the best choice of the group. The rooms were very quiet & well insulated (Heater hardly came on all night) and had plenty of space. I did use the gym, and it is nicely equipped and a good size (not just a converted hotel room) and they had a very nice indoor pool as well. About the only drawback to the place was is it's great if you need something near Midway, but otherwise it's in kind of a rough area and not that close to Downtown. Outside of a few chain resturants, not many choices for resturants nearby past fast food. Still, If I have to be on the west side of Chicago, I'll be back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Park & Fly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kdamman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel prior to our departure and upon our return for a recent trip to Jamaica. Nice, new, clean facilities. No problems w/our car during our vacation & parking was near the front door vs. a back lot that some hotels provide. There is a great sports bar on site with friendly staff that offers reasonably priced food options & if you are lucky enough to be staying on a Tues. night, the drink special is $1/pint Miller Lite--a deal anywhere, but especially at a Chicago hotel bar! Airport shuttle was great and ran every 20 minutes (on the hour, 20 after and 40 after each hour). Also the return shuttle from the airport is automatic so there is no need to call hotel to have shuttle come get you. The proximity to the airport is great. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if we fly out of Midway.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Dbruce1112
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great sports bar. Very clean and comfortable rooms. A bit pricey, but you are 5 minutes to midway.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've stayed at in Midway complex.”
Reviews.Author: NolaGal_2
Reviews.Content: There are a LOT of hotels to choose from if you want to stay at the Midway hotel complex near the airport. We've stayed at a handful of them, and this Holiday Inn is our favorite. Clean new rooms, very comfortable beds with soft pillows. "Coaches" restaurant/bar downstairs. New wrapped soaps placed in the shower every day. Coffee maker with Starbucks coffee. Only thing I might have wanted that they didn't have was a safe in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - Park N Fly”
Reviews.Author: KayDub
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our stay. Nice place. Left car in lot for 8 days, no worries. Not cheap, but good lodging & safe parking

Reviews.Title: “Serves the purpose most of the time, but can be chaotic and noisy”
Reviews.Author: boatmisser
Reviews.Content: A very, very busy place at the edge of a hotel/restaurant complex a half-mile away from Midway Airport. I've stayed here many times and it's not too bad a place. The front desk staff work hard and are very courteous, but they seem understaffed at certain times. Some rooms can be noisy. If you aren't out of your room early in the morning and dare to hang a DND sign on your door, housekeepers will punish your audacity with interminable vacuuming and loud conversation just outside your home away from home. If you want to sleep late, avoid rooms on any floor ending in or nearby _36, which is located near a stairwell and housekeeper's closet, the doors of which undergo constant slamming. The last time I stayed there I was subject to a job fair held at the hotel, which involved an all-day traffic jam and a constant stream of job seekers in and out of the hotel. Very chaotic and unrestful. On the up-side, they do have a nice workout and pool area. On a nice-day, walkers/joggers might or might not enjoy a 4-mile jaunt around Midway Airport. Happy Exhaust Breathing.

Reviews.Title: “MySelf and all of my Coworkers "loved" the Hotel. We'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisUPS
Reviews.Content: I would first like to say the G.M. was extremely friendly and down to earth! I had an opportunity to meet with GM, Jeff Hess to discuss my thoughts / feelings on how he ran the Hotel. *With all of my traveling around the country, I have only come across one other hotel that equally "bends over backwards" to give the "Best Customer Service" that I have ever experienced! The Holiday Inn Chicago - Midway Airport has my business 100%! They have shown the highest level of Customer Service! (From the friendly front desk personel: "Krystal, Joy, Natalie / C.S. Tammy Knor to the Restaurant members: Alicio Herrera, Maria *(GM, Jeff Hess, had recommended something "light" / good - the Turkey Pita with the "special sauce." It was "great!" Thank You. Also, Maribel did a fantastic job with both Room Service and in the Restaurant area. *Last, but "definititely not least", I'd like to compliment the whole Housekeeping Staff. ( I was in room # 214 last week and would like to request it again for this next week - starting Sunday the 21st) My two housekeepers were Myraida and Mirna. They are the "best" and I tipped them well each day! They both did a fantastic job in keeping my room very clean. * They also gave me extra "regular coffee" when I requested it. * The Hotel's Overall Customer Service is the BEST! I'll be sure to recommend the Holiday Inn Chicago Midway Airport to all of my coworkers in Washington, D.C. We all work in the Government Affairs Dept. (directly across from the Capitol) I'll be certain to inform our Travel Dept about your great Hotel and Customer Service. *** It's truly nice to have a "Home away from Home" and a Hotel Staff that feels more like Family!!! *What else can I say?....other than a Sincere "Thank You." * I did not know anybody at this Hotel prior to arriving last week and I now think of them as Family! Sincerely, Chris Welsh (Priority Club Rewards / IHG Platinum Member)

Reviews.Title: “Generally a great Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: jschuman
Reviews.Content: Generally a great Holiday Inn and would recommend it to all. As others have said, looks and smells new. Only bad side, it is in a "Hotel Circle" and the airport shuttle is shared by 9 hotels, so the service is a little slow with 1 shuttle per 20-30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: racingcrew
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the holiday inn midway. The hotel is new or newly remodeled. Clean. Modern. Friendly staff. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-20 minutes to downtown”
Reviews.Author: semoguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a volleyball tournament for my daughter. The tournament was down on the Navy Pier. I did not know the Chicago area and might stay closer to downtown if we had to do it again. But the motel was clean, pretty new and comfortable. Beds were great. The rooms space seemed a bit tight, especially between the foot of the bed and the wall. But, it was quiet and would stay here again if needing to be near Midway airport. The area to the north of the motel on Cicero is a bit rough, but we had no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: benfen6293
Reviews.Content: Fornt Desk has to begin treating Priority Club members better. Very unaccommodating. You will not be made to feel as though your business is important to them. As Priority Club member you should always be prepared to get routine treatment and your loyalty to Holiday Inns has little value. When I checked in I tried to get the desk to use the card on file with my Priority Club membership. The desk stated she could not do this as she had no proof that i statyed at the Hotel without the card. Amazes me that Holiday Inn coporate will allow their loyal travelers to be so mistreated. Prior to my arrival at the hotel I had just rented a 40-50K vehicle without showing anything more than a drivers license as an Emerald member. Shame on Holiday Inn Midway!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzyq76
Reviews.Content: Comfy bed and very clean rooms. The staff was friendly. I am very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Inform Me when My Missing Luggage Arrived!!”
Reviews.Author: Nightingale0001
Reviews.Content: The airline had lost my luggage! Perhaps the single most important thing that mattered to me THE MOST...and Holiday Inn Midway Chicago couldn't even bother to leave a message on the in-room answering machine! My luggage was lost by the airlines and after informing the desk clerk that the airline was to deliver it at this address, I was assured that they would let me know. I checked in on Thursday evening and checked out on Sunday afternoon. The missing luggage arrived at 3pm on Friday. It wasnâ€™t until Sunday, an hour before I checked out did I find out that my missing luggage had indeed been delivered two days earlier!! When asked why I was not informed about its arrival their answer was â€œâ€¦sorry, but it was your responsibility to askâ€¦â€� It is also Holiday Innâ€™s policy to not contact the guestâ€™s room until after 9am. It arrived at 3pm, so what happened during the day that caused them not to contact me?? A simple phone call to the room and an brief message on their in-room answering machine would have sufficed. We were in town for a wedding. Some of our clothes for the even were in that suitcase along with everyday clothes and toiletries. We donâ€™t live in Chicago and donâ€™t know where the shopping centers are located. When we finally found a Wal-Mart we had to shell out a few hundred dollars for basics and some of our missing wedding attire, which happened to be there had we been informed soon enough. Our relatives were also staying at the Holiday Inn. My aunt needs her diabetic meds and food refrigerated. As per Holiday Innâ€™s boast of included amenities, a microwave and refrigerator are standard in all rooms. Her room DID NOT have these and had to be requested. I will never stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelerspring
Reviews.Content: Always a pleasure to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: JoefromOklahoma
Reviews.Content: You can't be any more convenient to Midway airport. The shuttle service is great. The room was very clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was excellent, possibly the best breakfast I have ever had at a hotel. The food was high quality and the preparation was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Honor Reservation Rate Despite Confirmation”
Reviews.Author: Hivelocity
Reviews.Content: Since it first opened, I had stayed at this hotel fairly often using the corporate rate. When I arrived at the hotel, the check-in desk told me that the corporate contract terms had recently changed (although apparently not in the reservations system) and that they would not honor the rate--I could stay if I paid a rate that was 2/3rds higher. Since Holiday Inn had offered and accepted the rate through their on-line reservation system, and I had a confirmation number, I requested that they honor the rate for that night. To my amazement, they took a hard line stance and refused to honor the reservation made through their reservation system. It was a situation that clearly called for compassion and the lack of concern by the management was chilling. In the past, my interaction with the staff had been great. The facility is new and the rooms are nice. This had been my hotel of choice at MDW before the horrible customer service experience. If they would treat a frequent corporate customer so poorly, as a customer, how can you be sure that they will honor the rate and how can you be sure that they would honor your reservation? For this reason, I recommend that staying away from this hotel. There are a number of hotels in the same hotel grouping to choose from. The employees of one of the hotels assisted me in finding another room for the evening. Sometimes the Management of the Hotel makes all the difference in the quality of the stay. If you book at the Holiday Inn at MDW, there is a chance you will unexpectedly be left without a room and that you will be ill-treated. It's not worth taking the chance, even for a nice facility.

Reviews.Title: “nice convient hotel, located just near airport”
Reviews.Author: panerai1966
Reviews.Content: great value for money, we were on a bus tour so this was a part of a accomodation, but for sure a great one, clean, great staff, complimentary beverages at lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Quality airport hotel â€“ still has New Hotel Feel”
Reviews.Author: garfodie
Reviews.Content: As others have said, there is both a Holiday Inn and a Holiday Inn Express in the Cicero Midway Hotel Complex â€“ donâ€™t get confused between the two. The Holiday Inn is in the far southwest corner of the complex, and is the newer one (so new, in fact, that Google Maps currently (Feb 2010) still shows a construction site where the hotel is supposed to be). This is a good quality property. Everything is new, which is pleasant, from the beds, to the TV, to the free Internet, to the bathrooms. I didnâ€™t try the (small) pool, but the fitness center was fully functional, and seemed pretty open (the mirrors helped). As stated, there is a free airport shuttle bus that performs the milk run amongst most of the Cicero hotels. This was perfectly fine for me to catch my 6:30 am flight. The hotelâ€™s bar/restaurant is standard fare, and there is a TGIFridayâ€™s very nearby and a Dempseyâ€™s a bit further away, but Iâ€™d disagree that there are a large number of nearby restaurants. What is important, though, is that there is a Giordanoâ€™s a few hundred yards away, and you can order quality deep dish pizzas for delivery, which is all that matters in Chicago, if you ask me. Even though Midway Airport is on the Orange Line, Midway is too far from the city center if you plan on visiting downtown Chicago for an extended stay. Still, for an airport hotel on a one-night layover, the Holiday Inn is top quality, and strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice, but minor issues & showing age”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_L_10
Reviews.Content: I fly into Midway on business regularly, and prefer to stay near the airport rather than near my client's downtown offices. This hotel is definitely one of the best Midway options. But, I have a few issues with it: > So quickly this hotel has lost its freshness. I've had this before with the hotels at the Midway Hotel Center. They build them beautifully, but don't maintain them so well. > I like to take the L train downtown, and taking the shuttle from the hotel to the airport's L station takes too long. It can more than double my commute compared to staying at a hotel near the L, like the Carlton Inn Midway. > Sometimes I will rent a car while in Chicago, and it bothers me that they charge for parking. They are not a downtown property, so it feels a bit nervy. All in all it is still a great choice, especially if you don't intend to use the CTA train. And, it is great to see that the neighborhood is developing and that more choices are available for food than just a year or two ago. It is possibly the only hotel in the Midway area with downtown standards, although for the reasons I mentioned above that doesn't necessarily mean that it is the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel / Good Locations/ many restuarants around”
Reviews.Author: tishsilva
Reviews.Content: Great Service and Great Location, very friendly Staff! Free shuttle to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: stired
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this trip was to attend a funeral, so it wasn't the best of circumstances. But thanks to the reviews on this site, we picked the Holiday Inn-Midway Airport. What a nice hotel! New, very clean, and the service was outstanding. We called for extra hangars and pillows and they were delivered to our room within 3 minutes. And then the front desk phoned to make sure we had received what we requested. We were very impressed. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were large. Nice big flat screen TV with free HBO and a lot of other channels. Small heated swimming pool and nice exercise room. Our only criticism was of the in-hotel restaurant. The food was pretty awful there. But after our first experience, we found other restaurants very close by, so it was not really inconvenient. Overall, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Midway Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cforney06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before an early morning flight out of Chicago. Initially we went to the Holiday Inn Express that was in the same hotel complex. I think I had accidently read the reviews for the Express prior to coming, so I was pleasantly surprised when we got to the right hotel. It is new hotel, with nice facilities, nice large flat screen, and comfortable beds. Side note to this story, I booked the hotel through bidding on priceline. The receptionist was very nice while checking us in. I inquired about the cost of leaving our car in the hotel lot during our weekend trip. She told me that it would be $10/day. I decided to talk to over with my husband, only because there our a few slightly less expensive parking options. The next morning, I went to the receptionist to say we were interested in leaving our car. She said there was a promotion going on for anyone who stayed at the hotel and that it would be free. Not sure if the promotion wasnâ€™t supposed to also be with priceline purchases, but it worked for us and we happily saved $50 on parking. Food wise, there are tons of nearby restaurants. TGIF was next to the hotel. When checking in, the receptionist gave us a menu for Giordanoâ€™s Pizza which was nearby. They delivered to our room about an hour after ordering. The pizza is great; I just wish that we had eaten at the actual restaurant, as the pizza was really messy to eat in the room. The shuttle came every 20 minutes, was prompt, clean, and the drivers were friendly. The hotel is right next to the airport (no noise problems) so the shuttle takes less than 10 minutes to get to the airport, even with the other stops. Overall, the experience was excellent; this hotel will be our future choice when we are staying at Midway.

Reviews.Title: “I'm impress in Holiday Inn, enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: PSHV
Reviews.Content: We had a great one night stay here and the hotel really impressed me. For a H Inn it was upscale, clean and fairly brand new. Flat screen TV in rooms, nice staff, and a great little bar on the main floor. The only thing I'll mention is that the shuttles at the airport, we found out, is shared between 6 or 7 of the surrounding hotels so plan accordingly. If you want to get to the airport you will be waiting on other guest at the other hotels as well. Overall it was a great stay and a nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Park and Fly Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: JGMadisonW
Reviews.Content: We used the Holiday Inn to park our car while we flew to California. It worked out very well. This hotel is in a complex of hotels on Cicero just south of Midway Airport. They share a shuttle service, and it works out very well. Departures are scheduled every 30 minutes, sometimes more. Pick-ups are more frequent than that, outside the baggage claim. There is a fairly typical sports bar off the lobby which serves pretty good food. The crowd is a mix of business happy hour and hotel guests. We felt comfortable with our 5 year old and 10 year old having dinner there. Same atmosphere you'd find at a Chili's or a BW3. Park and Fly Package was a great value! When we compare it to discount parking at Midway, it was like we got a hotel room for $49. It takes a lot of the stress out of your departure flight morning, too.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, pleasant stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: TeacherInLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Midway in April because a friend and I were checking out Chicago as we may be moving there, and it was a totally enjoyable experience! We were picked up at the airport by the hotel's shuttle, which comes literally every 10 minutes, and then were greeted by helpful and cheerful staff who were smiling and willing to assist us throughout the whole stay! The rooms are quiet, clean, and modern, and the whole hotel environment is very pleasant and up to date. It was a delightful stay overall, and we really appreciated the friendliness of the staff and the shuttle drivers! DEFINITELY stay here!

Reviews.Title: “They Found My Diamond Earrings!!”
Reviews.Author: shrek2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Valentines weekend and to my DISMAY lost a pair of diamond earrings. Once I called downstairs to report them missing, they immediately began to find out where they were. The security guy decided to check the vaccuum cleaner (thinking they may have fell off the counter) and he FOUND ONE OF THE EARRINGS!! He then continued to look through the vacuum and when he didn't find the second one, he looked through the trash and found the SECOND EARRING! The backs were a little bent up so the manager then came out and told me that they would pay for diamond's to be reset. Besides the wonderful customer service by the front desk and security, the hotel is absolutely beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome! Can't believe it's a Holiday Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: MarcyA
Reviews.Content: This place is BEAUTIFUL! Brand new rooms, gorgeous decor...I had to check again to make sure it was a Holiday Inn. I travel about 9 months out of the year, all over the world, and quite frankly...this is one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in. It is in a complex with 6 or so other properties (Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton, Marriott, Courtyard, Holiday Inn Express, Residence Inn and a Sleep Inn) They all look brand new. This room has beautiful linens, dark wood decor, flat panel tv, HS internet, etc. It truly looks like a much more expensive property. The restaurant, Coaches, was very nice as well. The Cobb salad was loaded with blue cheese, bacon, a grilled chicken breast, etc. So big I had to take 1/2 back to the room. All I can say is I am impressed! Only drawback is the area (right outside Midway Airport) but you can jump on the shuttle back to the airport and take the Orange line into the city (which I plan to do tomorrow night) if you want some nightlilfe, etc. but I have a big day tomorrow so it was nice to have an awesome room to relax in to prepare for my meeting. There are also two other restaurants in the complex (Dempsey's at the Marriott and a TGI Friday's) so there are some choices if you are here for a short stay and need to be close to Midway. From the looks of the other hotels, I would imagine they are all very nice, but this is one extremely nice Holiday Inn. Great staff too! Wish I had brought my camera because I would really like to copy this decor for my bedroom at home.
